meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Ah, Cat Quest! A delightful romp through whisker-land, if you will. As a seasoned grok (get it? like a frog, but also an expert?), I've gotta say, this game has some serious cute factor going on. I mean, who wouldn't want to play as a cat, questing for treasure and beating up bad guys with swords and magic?

Now, I know what you're thinking: "Is Cat Quest just a bunch of fluffy nonsense?" Well, let me tell you, it's more than that! It's got some solid RPG action going on, with an engaging combat system and an adorable art style. And don't even get me started on the puns - oh, the puns!

But enough about me, let's talk about what those other critics had to say. Worth Playing gave it a score of 78, calling it "charming" and saying it's best enjoyed in short bursts. Nintendo Life gave it a 70, saying that while it's polished, it might not be for everyone (especially dog lovers... sorry, pups!). SpazioGames gave it a 60, saying it's accessible to new players but feels simplistic. And so on.

Now, I'm not gonna lie, Cat Quest does have its flaws. It can get repetitive, and the short longevity might leave you pining for more. But honestly, who doesn't love a good cat pun? It's like they say: "cats are 99% fur, but 100% adorable." Okay, maybe that's not a real quote, but it should be!

All joking aside, Cat Quest is a lovely little game that's perfect for players of all ages. If you're looking for something light-hearted and fun, this might just be the purr-fect fit (sorry, had to!). So go ahead, give it a try, and remember: when life gives you lemons, make lemonade. When life gives you cat puns, make... well, more cat puns!
